LaunchLocation.name: LC-3
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Pad 3 was one of the original pads at Cape Canaveral. After hosting the bumper missions, it was mostly used for the testing of winged missles.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-4
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Pad 4 was one of the original pads at Cape Canaveral. It was mostly used for the testing of winged missles.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-4A
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Pad 4A added to Launch Complex 3/4 to increase capacity.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-5
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 5/6 was built for the Army's short- and medium-range missle tests. Launch Pad 5 launched the first Americans into space on Mercury-Redstone rockets.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-6
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 5/6 was built for the Army's short- and medium-range missle tests.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-14
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 14 was built for intercontinental ballistic missiles, specificaly Atlas. LC-14 was used by NASA to launch the first American into orbit.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-15
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 15 was built for intercontinental ballistic missiles, specificaly Titan.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-16
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 16 was built for intercontinental ballistic missiles, specificaly Titan.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-19
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 19 was built for intercontinental ballistic missiles, specificaly Titan. NASA used it to launch the Gemini missions on Titan II rockets.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-34
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 34 was built to support the Saturn I rocket and crewed flights of the Apollo program. Gus Grisssom, Ed White, and Roger Chaffee lost their lives on this pad in the Apollo 1 fire.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-37A
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 37 was built to support the Saturn I rocket and crewed flights of the Apollo program. Launch Pad 37A was never finished.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-37B
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 37 was built to support the Saturn I rocket and crewed flights of the Apollo program.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-39A
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 39 was built to support the enormous Saturn V rocket that sent people to the moon.

LaunchLocation.name: LC-39B
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 39 was built to support the enormous Saturn V rocket that sent people to the moon.

LaunchLocation.name: SLC-41
LaunchLocation.description: Launch Complex 41 was built to support the Titan III rocket.

LaunchLocation.name: Skid-Strip
LaunchLocation.description: The skid strip is a military runway, sometimes used by planes delivering rocket parts to the Cape.

LaunchLocation.name: KSC Runway
LaunchLocation.description: The Space Shuttle Landing facility is one of the longest runways in the world. It was constructed for landings of the Space Shuttle.
